question:
Which of the following is NOT a member of the Arthropoda phylum?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)
solution:
• Pila is not a member of the phylum Arthropoda.
  • It belongs to the phylum Mollusca.
  • Arthropoda includes organisms with segmented bodies, jointed appendages, and an exoskeleton made of chitin.
  • Locust, Butterfly, and Prawn are all classified under Arthropoda:
    • Locust – Class: Insecta
    • Butterfly – Class: Insecta
    • Prawn – Class: Crustacea
  • Pila (apple snail) is an aquatic mollusk and lacks jointed appendages.

Additional Information:

  • Arthropoda is the largest phylum in the animal kingdom.
  • It includes insects, arachnids, crustaceans, and myriapods.
  • Pila globosa is a common species of freshwater mollusk found in India.

question:
Which of the following choices is related to the phylum Ceolenterata?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• Aurelia belongs to the phylum Coelenterata (also known as Cnidaria).
  • Organisms in this phylum are aquatic, mostly marine, and have radial symmetry.
  • They possess cnidoblasts (stinging cells) used for defense and capturing prey.
  • Aurelia is a genus of jellyfish, a typical example of Coelenterates.
  • Other options:
    • Spongilla, Euspongia, and Sycon all belong to the phylum Porifera, not Coelenterata.

Additional Information:

  • Coelenterata includes Hydra, Obelia, Aurelia, and Sea anemones.
  • They have a gastrovascular cavity with a single opening.
  • Two body forms: polyp (Hydra) and medusa (Aurelia).
  • Aurelia is commonly known as the moon jellyfish.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a protozoan?

SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• Scypha is not a protozoan; it belongs to the phylum Porifera.
  • Protozoans are unicellular, eukaryotic organisms typically classified under the kingdom Protista.
  • The other three:
    • Euglena – a flagellated protozoan with both plant and animal characteristics.
    • Amoeba – a shapeless protozoan that moves using pseudopodia.
    • Plasmodium – a parasitic protozoan that causes malaria.
  • Scypha is a multicellular sponge found in marine water, making it part of Porifera, not Protozoa.

Additional Information:

  • Protozoans exhibit various modes of locomotion: flagella, cilia, or pseudopodia.
  • They can be free-living or parasitic.
  • Porifera (like Scypha) are sessile filter-feeders and lack tissues and organs.
  • Scypha is also called Sycon, a common genus of sponge.

question:
Identify the third germinal layer found in triploblastic animals.

SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• In triploblastic animals, there are three germinal (embryonic) layers:
    1. Ectoderm – outer layer
    2. Endoderm – inner layer
    3. Mesoderm – third or middle layer
  • The Mesoderm gives rise to muscles, bones, blood, and internal organs.
  • This third layer is absent in diploblastic animals (which have only ectoderm and endoderm).
  • Therefore, Mesoderm is the correct answer.

Additional Information:

  • Triploblastic animals include members of Platyhelminthes and higher phyla.
  • Presence of mesoderm allows organ-level complexity in animals.
  • Coelom (body cavity) is derived from the mesoderm, but it is not itself a germinal layer.

question:
Which is the following is a roundworm?

SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
solution:
• Ascaris is a roundworm and belongs to the phylum Nematoda.
  • Roundworms have a cylindrical, unsegmented body, and are triploblastic, pseudocoelomates.
  • They have a complete digestive system (with mouth and anus).
  • Other options:
    • Planaria – flatworm (phylum: Platyhelminthes)
    • Liver fluke – flatworm (phylum: Platyhelminthes)
    • Taenia – tapeworm, also a flatworm (phylum: Platyhelminthes)
  • Hence, only Ascaris is a roundworm.

Additional Information:

  • Ascaris causes ascariasis, a common intestinal infection.
  • Nematodes are found in soil, freshwater, marine environments, and as parasites.
  • They show bilateral symmetry and lack segmentation.

question:
Which of the following organisms belongs to phylum Apicomplexa?

SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• Plasmodium belongs to the phylum Apicomplexa, which includes unicellular, parasitic protozoans.
  • Members of Apicomplexa are non-motile in their mature form and are obligate parasites.
  • Plasmodium is well known for causing malaria in humans.
  • Other options:
    • Physalia – phylum Cnidaria (colonial marine organism)
    • Hydra – phylum Cnidaria (freshwater organism)
    • Sponge – phylum Porifera (multicellular aquatic animal)

Additional Information:

  • Apicomplexa are characterized by an organelle complex called the apical complex, used to invade host cells.
  • Plasmodium vivax, Plasmodium falciparum, etc., are different species that infect humans.
  • These organisms reproduce both sexually and asexually and have a complex life cycle involving a host (e.g., humans and mosquitoes).

question:
Which of the following pairs is INCORRECTLY matched?

SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The pair (b) Ancylostoma – Pinworm is incorrectly matched.
  • Ancylostoma is a genus of hookworms, not pinworms.
  • Pinworm is caused by Enterobius vermicularis, not Ancylostoma.
  • Correct matches:
    • Wuchereria – Filaria worm (causes filariasis)
    • Taenia – Tapeworm (parasitic flatworm)
    • Ascaris – Roundworm (causes ascariasis)

Additional Information:

  • Ancylostoma duodenale causes hookworm infection, leading to anemia.
  • Hookworms are nematodes (roundworms) and attach to the intestinal walls.
  • Pinworm infections are common in children and cause intense anal itching.
  • Wuchereria bancrofti affects the lymphatic system and leads to elephantiasis.

question:
What is Typholps?

SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Typhlops is a genus of blind snakes and is correctly matched with option (a) Blind snake.
  • These snakes are non-venomous, burrowing reptiles typically found in tropical and subtropical regions.
  • They are called “blind snakes” because their eyes are small and often covered by scales, making them nearly blind.
  • They feed mostly on ants and termites.

Additional Information:

  • Belong to the family Typhlopidae.
  • Blind snakes resemble earthworms and are often mistaken for them.
  • They play a beneficial role in ecosystems by controlling ant and termite populations.
  • Unlike glass or sea snakes, they live underground and are not aquatic or transparent.

question:
Select the incorrect statement about Phylum Arthropoda.

SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)
option_1: Class insect is the largest class of phylum Arthropoda
option_2: Lignin is the main component of the exoskeletons of arthropods
option_3: Over 85% of all the known animal species are arthropods
option_4: Phylum Arthropoda comprises a wide diversity of animals with hard exoskeletons and jointed appendages
solution:
• The incorrect statement is:

    (b) Lignin is the main component of the exoskeletons of arthropods.

  • Lignin is a complex organic polymer found in plants, especially in wood and bark, providing structural support.
  • In arthropods, the main component of the exoskeleton is chitin, a nitrogenous polysaccharide.
  • The other statements are correct:
    • Insects form the largest class within Arthropoda.
    • Arthropods make up over 85% of all known animal species.
    • They exhibit a wide range of forms with jointed limbs and hard exoskeletons.

Additional Information:

  • Phylum Arthropoda includes insects, arachnids (spiders), crustaceans (crabs, prawns), and myriapods (centipedes, millipedes).
  • The chitinous exoskeleton is periodically shed in a process called molting or ecdysis.
  • Arthropods show bilateral symmetry and have a segmented body.

question:
Match the animals in column A with the phylum they belong to in column B.

SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749539047570_image001.png
option_1: i-a, ii-c, iii-b, iv-d
option_2: i-d, ii-a, iii-b, iv-c
option_3: i-a, ii-b, iii-c, iv-d
option_4: i-d, ii-c, iii-b, iv-a
solution:
Let's match each animal from Column-A with the correct phylum from Column-B:

  1. Jellyfish → d. Coelenterata
    • Jellyfish are marine animals belonging to phylum Cnidaria (also called Coelenterata).
  2. Crayfish → c. Insect (Incorrect)
    • Crayfish are crustaceans, and they belong to phylum Arthropoda, not Insecta (but still under Arthropoda; so 'Insect' is being used loosely for classification).
  3. Whale fish → b. Mammal
    • Whales are aquatic mammals (warm-blooded, give birth to young, have lungs).
  4. Devil fish (Octopus) → a. Mollusca
    • Devil fish or octopus belongs to phylum Mollusca.

Thus, correct match:

  • i → d
  • ii → c
  • iii → b
  • iv → a

Correct Option: (d)

question:
Which from the following is a phylum of animals found in found in fresh water ponds, lakes and swaps provides setae or parapodia for locomotion?

SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Annelida.
  • Annelids are segmented worms commonly found in freshwater ponds, lakes, and swamps.
  • They possess locomotory structures such as:
    • Setae – bristle-like structures in earthworms.
    • Parapodia – paddle-like appendages in polychaetes (marine annelids), aiding in movement.
  • These adaptations help annelids move through soil or water efficiently.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Ctenophora – Marine organisms with cilia, not found in freshwater.
  • (b) Porifera – Sponges, mostly aquatic but sessile and without locomotory organs.
  • (d) Platyhelminthes – Flatworms, many are parasitic and lack parapodia/setae.

Additional Information:

  • Annelids include earthworms, leeches, and marine polychaetes.
  • They have a true coelom, segmented body, and closed circulatory system.
  • Setae help in anchorage and movement in soil or aquatic habitats.

question:
Identify an organism that has a well-defined muscular pharynx.

SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Ascaris.
  • Ascaris is a parasitic roundworm belonging to phylum Nematoda.
  • It has a well-developed, muscular pharynx, which helps in sucking food from the host's intestine.
  • This muscular pharynx plays a crucial role in its parasitic feeding mechanism.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Adamsia – A sea anemone (phylum: Cnidaria); lacks a muscular pharynx.
  • Ctenoplana – Belongs to phylum Ctenophora, has simple body structure without a defined pharynx.
  • Gorgonia – A colonial coral (phylum: Cnidaria); does not possess a muscular pharynx.

Additional Information:

  • Ascaris lumbricoides infects human intestines and causes ascariasis.
  • It shows pseudocoelomate body structure, bilateral symmetry, and a complete digestive tract.
  • Its pharynx is triangular in cross-section and highly muscular for suction.

question:
Which type of liverworts form umbrella-shaped structures that raise gametangia above the main gametophyte body and sporophytes develop below these structures?

SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (d) Marchantia.
  • Marchantia is a liverwort, belonging to division Bryophyta, class Hepaticopsida.
  • It forms umbrella-shaped structures called:
    • Antheridiophores (male) and
    • Archegoniophores (female)

      These structures elevate the gametangia above the gametophyte body.

  • The sporophytes develop beneath these elevated structures after fertilization.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Polytrichum and Funaria – both are mosses, not liverworts (Class: Bryopsida).
  • Sphagnum – a type of peat moss, also a bryophyte but not a liverwort.

Additional Information:

  • Marchantia's gametophyte is dorsiventrally flattened and thalloid.
  • Fertilization occurs in the archegonium, and the resulting sporophyte remains attached to the gametophyte.
  • These specialized structures help in effective dispersal and protection of gametes and spores.

question:
Meandrina is the generic name of which coelenterate animal having soft tube-shaped bodies that live together in large groups?

SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Brain Coral.
  • Meandrina is the genus of coelenterate animals commonly known as brain corals.
  • These animals have soft, tube-shaped bodies and live in large colonial groups.
  • Their surface shows grooved patterns resembling the folds of the human brain, hence the name.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Sea anemone – solitary cnidarians, not colonial like brain corals.
  • Sea-fan (Gorgonia) – a type of soft coral with a fan-like appearance.
  • Medusa – a free-swimming stage in the life cycle of some cnidarians (e.g., jellyfish), not a colony-forming organism.

Additional Information:

  • Brain corals belong to class Anthozoa, phylum Cnidaria (Coelenterata).
  • They contribute significantly to the formation of coral reefs.
  • They are sessile, meaning they remain fixed in one place throughout their lives.

question:
Identify the animal that does NOT have bilateral symmetry.

SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (d) Cnidarian.
  • Cnidarians (e.g., jellyfish, sea anemones, Hydra) exhibit radial symmetry, not bilateral symmetry.
  • In radial symmetry, body parts are arranged around a central axis, allowing the organism to interact with the environment from all directions.
  • The other phyla listed have bilateral symmetry, where the body can be divided into two mirror-image halves.

Other Options (Correctly Show Bilateral Symmetry):

  • Annelida – Segmented worms (e.g., earthworms) with bilateral symmetry.
  • Molluscs – Includes snails, octopuses; body is bilaterally symmetrical (even if the shell appears coiled).
  • Arthropoda – Includes insects, crustaceans; clearly bilateral body plan.

Additional Information:

  • Bilateral symmetry is associated with cephalization (concentration of sense organs at the head).
  • Radial symmetry is typical of sessile or slow-moving aquatic animals, allowing uniform response in all directions.

question:
Which group of kingdom Animalia has unsegmented, bilaterally symmetrical, soft bodies, with a triploblastic construction (comprising three layers of cells) and a lacking coelom, skeleton and anus?

SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Platyhelminthes.
  • Platyhelminthes (flatworms) are:
    • Unsegmented
    • Bilaterally symmetrical
    • Triploblastic (having three germ layers)
    • Acoelomate (lack a true body cavity)
    • Lack an anus – they have an incomplete digestive system with a single opening
    • Lack skeletons

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Cnidaria – Diploblastic (two germ layers), radially symmetrical, not bilaterally symmetrical.
  • Ctenophora – Also diploblastic and radially symmetrical; marine organisms with cilia.
  • Porifera – Asymmetrical or radially symmetrical; simplest multicellular animals without true tissues or germ layers.

Additional Information:

  • Platyhelminthes include organisms like planaria, tapeworms, and liver flukes.
  • They exhibit cephalization and are often parasitic.
  • Their flattened body helps in diffusion of gases and nutrients, compensating for the lack of a circulatory system.

question:
In which of the following animal phyla, is the body divided into head, thorax and abdomen?

SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Arthropoda.
  • In Arthropoda, especially in the class Insecta, the body is clearly divided into three regions:
    • Head – bears sensory organs and mouthparts
    • Thorax – bears legs and wings (if present)
    • Abdomen – contains digestive and reproductive structures
  • This segmented body plan is a key feature of arthropods.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Annelida – Body is segmented uniformly without division into head, thorax, and abdomen.
  • Mollusca – Body typically has a head, muscular foot, and visceral mass, not the head-thorax-abdomen division.
  • Chordata – While some advanced vertebrates have a head and trunk, the tripartite division is not a defining trait.

Additional Information:

  • Arthropods include insects, crustaceans, arachnids, and myriapods.
  • They also have jointed appendages and a chitinous exoskeleton.
  • Insects are the most diverse class under Arthropoda and display this segmentation most distinctly.

question:
Identify an endoparasite found in animals.

SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Flatworms.
  • Flatworms (phylum: Platyhelminthes) include many endoparasitic species that live inside the bodies of animals.
  • Examples of parasitic flatworms:
    • Taenia (tapeworm) – lives in intestines of humans and animals
    • Fasciola (liver fluke) – infects the liver of sheep and cattle
  • These organisms absorb nutrients directly from the host and often have complex life cycles.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Pleurobrachia – belongs to phylum Ctenophora, free-living marine animal, not a parasite.
  • Ctenoplana – also a ctenophore, free-living, non-parasitic marine organism.
  • Adamsia – a sea anemone (phylum: Cnidaria), commonly lives in mutualistic association with hermit crabs, not an endoparasite.

Additional Information:

  • Flatworms are triploblastic, acoelomate, and often show bilateral symmetry.
  • Endoparasitic flatworms have adaptations like hooks, suckers, and thick tegument for survival inside the host.
  • Some can cause serious diseases like taeniasis and fascioliasis in humans and animals.

question:
Match the columns.

Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (3rd shift)


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749539047570_image002.png
option_1: i-a, ii-b, iii-d, iv-c
option_2: i-a, ii-b, iii-c, iv-d
option_3: i-b, ii-a, iii-d, iv-c
option_4: i-b, ii-a, iii-c, iv-d
solution:
Let's match each Phylum with its correct Animal:

  1. Protozoa → b. Amoeba
    • Amoeba is a unicellular organism belonging to Protozoa.
  2. Nematoda → a. Roundworm
    • Roundworms like Ascaris belong to Nematoda.
  3. Arthropoda → d. Cockroach
    • Cockroach has jointed legs and segmented body; belongs to Arthropoda.
  4. Echinodermata → c. Starfish
    • Starfish is a marine organism from Echinodermata, known for radial symmetry.

Correct Matching:

  • i → b
  • ii → a
  • iii → d
  • iv → c

Correct Option: (c)

question:
Which of the following does NOT belong to class Insecta?

Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Scorpion.
  • Scorpion belongs to the class Arachnida, not Insecta.
  • Arachnids have:
    • 4 pairs of legs (8 legs)
    • Two body segments: cephalothorax and abdomen
    • No antennae

Other Options (Correctly Belong to Insecta):

  • Cockroach, Mosquito, and Silverfish are all members of class Insecta, characterized by:
    • 3 pairs of legs (6 legs)
    • Three body segments: head, thorax, and abdomen
    • One pair of antennae
    • Usually two pairs of wings (though some may be wingless)

Additional Information:

  • Insecta is the largest class in the animal kingdom.
  • Insects show great diversity in form and habitat.
  • Scorpions are more closely related to spiders and other arachnids.

question:
Identify an algae that undergoes anisogamous fusion of gametes.

Matric Level 28/06/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Eudorina.
  • Eudorina is a colonial green alga that reproduces sexually through anisogamous fusion.
  • In anisogamy, the gametes differ in size or form, though both are motile.
  • Eudorina shows anisogamous reproduction, where the male and female gametes are dissimilar but both can swim.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Spirogyra – reproduces by isogamous fusion (gametes are morphologically similar).
  • Volvox – typically shows isogamous or anisogamous fusion, but less specifically than Eudorina.
  • Ulothrix – also exhibits isogamous reproduction, with similar-looking gametes.

Additional Information:

  • Anisogamy is an intermediate form between isogamy (equal gametes) and oogamy (large non-motile egg and small motile sperm).
  • Eudorina belongs to Chlorophyceae, a class of green algae.

question:
The _______ is an embryonic midline structure common to all members of the phylum Chordata that serves as a source of midline signals to surrounding tissues and as a major skeletal element of the developing embryo.

Matric Level 28/06/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Notochord.
  • The notochord is a flexible, rod-shaped structure found in the embryos of all chordates.
  • It lies along the midline of the embryo and:
    • Provides structural support.
    • Acts as a signaling center during development.
    • Helps in the formation of the neural tube (which becomes the central nervous system).
  • In many vertebrates, it is later replaced by the vertebral column (spine), but it is always present during embryonic development.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Nerve cord – a dorsal, hollow structure that develops into the brain and spinal cord, but not the primary skeletal element.
  • Tail fin – found in aquatic animals but not an embryonic midline structure common to all chordates.
  • Anus – part of the digestive tract; not a skeletal or signaling embryonic structure.

Additional Information:

  • Presence of a notochord is a key feature of the phylum Chordata.
  • Other key features include a dorsal nerve cord, pharyngeal slits, post-anal tail, and an endostyle or thyroid gland.

question:
Match the points under List I with those under List II.

SSC CHSL Tier-II 26/06/2023


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749539047570_image003.png
solution:
Let's match each Phylum in List I with the correct Example in List II:

  1. Porifera → a. Sponge
    • Porifera includes simple aquatic animals with pores, like sponges.
  2. Cnidaria → d. Jellyfish
    • Cnidarians have stinging cells (cnidoblasts); examples include jellyfish, hydra, sea anemone.
  3. Mollusca → b. Squid
    • Molluscs are soft-bodied animals, often with shells; squid, octopus, and snails are examples.
  4. Arthropoda → c. Centipede
    • Arthropods have jointed legs and segmented bodies; centipedes are myriapod arthropods.

Correct Match:

  • 1 → a
  • 2 → d
  • 3 → b
  • 4 → c

Correct Option: (b)

question:
Balanoglossus belongs to which of the following phylums of the animal kingdom?

SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Morning)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Hemichordata.
  • Balanoglossus is a marine worm-like animal that belongs to the phylum Hemichordata.
  • Hemichordates are considered "half chordates" because they share some features with chordates but lack a true notochord.

Key Characteristics of Hemichordata:

  • Body is divided into three parts: proboscis, collar, and trunk.
  • Possess a notochord-like structure called stomochord (not a true notochord).
  • Marine habitat and mostly burrowing lifestyle.
  • Example organisms: Balanoglossus, Saccoglossus.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Arthropoda – includes insects, crustaceans, arachnids (e.g., cockroach, prawn).
  • Echinodermata – includes marine animals like starfish and sea urchins.
  • Mollusca – includes soft-bodied animals like snails, squids, and octopuses.

Additional Information:

  • Balanoglossus is often studied in evolutionary biology due to its link between invertebrates and chordates.
  • It has pharyngeal gill slits, a feature also seen in chordates.

question:
Which among the following is an example of phylum Mammalia of Animal Kingdom?

SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Rat.
  • Rat is a classic example of the phylum Chordata, class Mammalia.
  • Mammals are warm-blooded vertebrates characterized by:
    • Presence of mammary glands (for feeding young)
    • Hair or fur on the body
    • Live birth (mostly, except monotremes)
    • Four-chambered heart

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Crocodile – Belongs to class Reptilia
  • (b) Hen – Belongs to class Aves (Birds)
  • (d) Pigeon – Also belongs to class Aves

Additional Information:

  • Mammals include animals such as humans, rats, dogs, whales, bats, etc.
  • Rats also show typical mammalian traits like internal fertilization, lungs for breathing, and parental care.

question:
Mosquito belong to _______ phylum of the animal kingdom.

SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Arthropoda.
  • Mosquito is an insect, and insects belong to the phylum Arthropoda, class Insecta.
  • Arthropods are characterized by:
    • Segmented body (head, thorax, abdomen)
    • Jointed appendages
    • Exoskeleton made of chitin
    • Open circulatory system

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • Ctenophora – Marine, jelly-like animals with cilia (e.g., comb jellies); not insects.
  • Chordata – Includes vertebrates like mammals, birds, fishes, etc.; mosquitoes are invertebrates.
  • Mollusca – Includes soft-bodied animals like snails, octopuses, and squids.

Additional Information:

  • Mosquitoes undergo complete metamorphosis (egg → larva → pupa → adult).
  • They are known vectors for diseases like malaria, dengue, chikungunya, etc.

question:
Snails is an example of which of the phylum of the animal kingdom?

SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Mollusca.
  • Snails are classic examples of the phylum Mollusca, which includes soft-bodied animals, often with a calcium carbonate shell.
  • Key features of Mollusca:
    • Unsegmented, soft body
    • Presence of a muscular foot (used for movement)
    • Mantle that may secrete a shell
    • Most have radula (a tongue-like feeding organ)

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Protochordate – Primitive chordates like Amphioxus; snails are not chordates.
  • (c) Annelida – Segmented worms like earthworms and leeches.
  • (d) Arthropoda – Insects, spiders, crustaceans with jointed legs and segmented bodies.

Additional Information:

  • Snails exhibit bilateral symmetry and open circulatory system (except cephalopods).
  • Other molluscs include octopus, squid, clams, and oysters.

question:
Which of the following is an endemic species?

SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Nicobar pigeon.
  • An endemic species is one that is native to a particular region and found nowhere else in the world.
  • The Nicobar pigeon is endemic to the Nicobar Islands of India and surrounding island regions in Southeast Asia.
  • It is known for its distinctive metallic green plumage and limited geographic range.

Other Options (Not Strictly Endemic):

  • Indian wild ass – Found mainly in Gujarat's Little Rann of Kutch, but not entirely endemic as some subspecies exist elsewhere in Asia.
  • Desert fox – Also found in parts of Pakistan and Afghanistan; not restricted to India.
  • Indian rhino – Though found mainly in Assam and parts of Nepal, it is not exclusive to India.

Additional Information:

  • Endemic species are often more vulnerable to extinction due to habitat loss or environmental changes.
  • Conservation of endemic species is critical to preserve regional biodiversity.

question:
Which among the following pairs of ‘animal – phylum of animal kingdom they belong’ is incorrect?

SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Liver fluke – Nematoda, which is incorrectly matched.
  • Liver fluke belongs to the phylum Platyhelminthes, not Nematoda.
  • Liver flukes are flatworms, typically endoparasitic in nature, and have a dorsoventrally flattened body.

Correct Matches:

  • (b) Sycon – Porifera

    ✔ Sycon is a sponge, correctly placed in phylum Porifera.

  • (c) Prawns – Arthropoda

    ✔ Prawns are crustaceans, a sub-group of Arthropoda.

  • (d) Starfish – Echinodermata

    ✔ Starfish are marine animals under phylum Echinodermata, known for radial symmetry and a water vascular system.

Additional Information:

  • Nematoda includes roundworms like Ascaris, not flatworms.
  • Platyhelminthes includes flat-bodied organisms like planaria, tapeworms, and liver flukes.
  • Knowing the phylum helps in understanding body structure, symmetry, and habitat.

question:
Hydra is an example of which of the following phylum of the animal kingdom?

SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Coelenterata (also known as Cnidaria).
  • Hydra is a freshwater organism that belongs to the phylum Coelenterata.
  • It is characterized by:
    • Radial symmetry
    • Diploblastic body (two germ layers)
    • Presence of cnidoblasts (stinging cells) for capturing prey and defense
    • A gastrovascular cavity with a single opening (mouth)

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Platyhelminthes – Includes flatworms like planaria and liver fluke, not hydra.
  • (b) Nematoda – Includes roundworms like Ascaris, which are bilaterally symmetrical and triploblastic.
  • (d) Porifera – Includes sponges; they have a porous body and no specialized tissues or organs.

Additional Information:

  • Hydra reproduces both asexually (budding) and sexually.
  • It has the unique ability to regenerate, making it a model organism in developmental biology.

question:
Which of the following comes under the platyhelminthese classification under the Animalia?

SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (d) Tapeworm.
  • Tapeworm is a classic example of the phylum Platyhelminthes (flatworms).
  • Platyhelminthes are:
    • Dorsoventrally flattened
    • Triploblastic and acoelomate
    • Often parasitic, with simple or no digestive systems
    • Exhibit bilateral symmetry

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Sycon – Belongs to phylum Porifera (sponges)
  • (b) Leech – Belongs to phylum Annelida (segmented worms)
  • (c) Wuchereria – A roundworm, belongs to phylum Nematoda

Additional Information:

  • Tapeworms (e.g., Taenia) live in the intestines of host animals and absorb nutrients directly through their body surface.
  • They consist of segments called proglottids and a head region called the scolex, which bears hooks and suckers.

question:
Which group of animals are named because of their spiny skin and have a peculiar water-driven tube system that they use for moving around?

SSC CGL Tier-II 03/03/2023
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Echinodermata.
  • The term Echinodermata comes from the Greek words "echinos" (spiny) and "derma" (skin), meaning spiny-skinned animals.
  • They are exclusively marine animals and are known for having:
    • A spiny or leathery skin
    • A water vascular system – a unique hydraulic system used for locomotion, respiration, and food capture
    • Tube feet, operated by the water vascular system, help them move

Examples:

  • Starfish, Sea urchins, Sea cucumbers, and Brittle stars

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Hemichordata – Marine animals with a primitive notochord-like structure (e.g., Balanoglossus)
  • (b) Aschelminthes – Another name for Nematoda, roundworms with pseudocoelomic body structure
  • (d) Mollusca – Soft-bodied animals (e.g., snails, octopuses), typically with a calcareous shell and muscular foot

Additional Information:

  • Echinoderms exhibit radial symmetry (usually pentamerous) in adults, and bilateral symmetry in larvae.
  • They have an endoskeleton made of calcareous plates and no excretory organs.

question:
Identify an example of organisms that are free-swimming and bottom-dwelling forms.

SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Zooplankton.
  • Zooplankton are microscopic to small aquatic animals that float or swim weakly in water currents.
  • They include free-swimming forms like protozoa and small crustaceans, as well as some bottom-dwelling (benthic) larval stages.
  • They are heterotrophic and feed on phytoplankton and other microscopic organisms.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Phytoplankton – These are photosynthetic, plant-like plankton; not bottom-dwelling, and mostly drifting organisms.
  • (c) Fungi – Mostly terrestrial and non-aquatic; they are non-motile and do not belong to free-swimming aquatic forms.
  • (d) Jellyfishes – These are free-swimming marine animals, but not bottom-dwelling.

Additional Information:

  • Zooplankton play a key role in aquatic food chains, linking primary producers (phytoplankton) with larger predators like fish.
  • Examples include copepods, krill, rotifers, and protozoans like Paramecium.

question:
Identify the organism that is NOT a pseudocoelomate.

SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (d) Scorpions.
  • Scorpions belong to the phylum Arthropoda, class Arachnida, and are coelomates — animals that possess a true coelom (body cavity) completely lined with mesoderm.
  • The other three organisms — Ancylostoma, Ascaris, and Wuchereria — are pseudocoelomates and belong to the phylum Nematoda (roundworms).

Key Concepts:

  • Pseudocoelomate: Organisms with a body cavity not fully lined by mesoderm (e.g., Nematoda).
  • Coelomate: Organisms with a true coelom, fully lined with mesoderm (e.g., Arthropoda, Annelida, Chordata).

Classification of the Options:

  • Ancylostoma – Hookworm, phylum Nematoda → Pseudocoelomate
  • Ascaris – Roundworm, phylum Nematoda → Pseudocoelomate
  • Wuchereria – Filarial worm, phylum Nematoda → Pseudocoelomate
  • Scorpions – Arachnids, phylum Arthropoda → Coelomate

Additional Information:

  • Coelomates have better-organized organ systems due to the presence of a true body cavity.
  • Pseudocoelomates often have simpler body structures and rely on body fluid for transport of nutrients and waste.

question:
Identify an example of decomposers that are found in the bottom of a pond.

SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (4th shift)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Flagellates.
  • Flagellates are a type of protists (often classified under protozoans) that use flagella for movement.
  • Some flagellates are decomposers found at the bottom of ponds, where they break down organic matter and contribute to nutrient cycling.
  • They feed on dead and decaying materials, aiding in decomposition.

Other Options (Incorrect):

  • (a) Zooplankton – Microscopic aquatic animals that float in water and feed on phytoplankton; not decomposers.
  • (b) Jellyfishes – Free-swimming marine animals, not found at pond bottoms and not decomposers.
  • (d) Phytoplankton – Microscopic photosynthetic organisms (like algae); they are producers, not decomposers.

Additional Information:

  • Decomposers are vital for breaking down dead organisms, recycling nutrients like carbon and nitrogen back into the ecosystem.
  • In aquatic environments like ponds, decomposers include bacteria, fungi, and some protozoans like flagellates.

question:
Identify the animal that is NOT a non-chordate.

SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (4th shift)
solution:
• Reptiles belong to the phylum Chordata, not to the non-chordate group.
  • They possess all key chordate features, such as:
    • A notochord (during embryonic stage)
    • A dorsal hollow nerve cord
    • Pharyngeal gill slits (in early development)
    • A post-anal tail
    • A vertebral column (backbone)
  • Therefore, Reptiles are chordates, not non-chordates.

Other Options (Non-Chordates):

  • Arthropods – Invertebrates with jointed limbs and exoskeleton (e.g., insects, crabs, spiders)
  • Porifera – Simple aquatic animals like sponges; lack true tissues and organs
  • Arachnids – A class under Arthropoda including spiders and scorpions; all are invertebrates
